body_html:
In my view, it should be python memory problem i believe. And for the features like uid and itemid, very large number should be normal case. Using categorical_column_with_hash_bucket, I believe will meet same problem, because the samples is bigger than 1e10. 2017-09-26 5:02 GMT+08:00 Paul Tucker <notifications@github.com>:
…
It seems likely that the hang and crash is due to the python interpreter running out of memory. It would be difficult to anticipate the bound at which that is likely to happen on a given computer. The documentation here <https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/feature_column/categorical_column_with_identity> does suggest that using large indexes is not a good idea. Are you really using all or most of the values in this 1.5e9 range? The documentation suggests using categorical_column_with_hash_bucket if not. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#13179 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AF3zuhLNZrhqXikL5K-hJi6BLlXlFl6tks5smBTagaJpZM4Pd0Et> .
-- --------------------------------------- 拓宇 宁静以致远
body_text:
In my view, it should be python memory problem i believe. And for the
features like uid and itemid, very large number should be normal case.

Using categorical_column_with_hash_bucket, I believe will meet same
problem, because the samples is bigger than 1e10.

2017-09-26 5:02 GMT+08:00 Paul Tucker <notifications@github.com>:
…
 It seems likely that the hang and crash is due to the python interpreter
 running out of memory. It would be difficult to anticipate the bound at
 which that is likely to happen on a given computer. The documentation here
 <https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/feature_column/categorical_column_with_identity>
 does suggest that using large indexes is not a good idea. Are you really
 using all or most of the values in this 1.5e9 range? The documentation
 suggests using categorical_column_with_hash_bucket if not.

body:
In my view, it should be python memory problem i believe. And for the
features like uid and itemid, very large number should be normal case.

Using categorical_column_with_hash_bucket, I believe will meet same
problem, because the samples is bigger than 1e10.

2017-09-26 5:02 GMT+08:00 Paul Tucker <notifications@github.com>:

> It seems likely that the hang and crash is due to the python interpreter
> running out of memory. It would be difficult to anticipate the bound at
> which that is likely to happen on a given computer. The documentation here
> <https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/feature_column/categorical_column_with_identity>
> does suggest that using large indexes is not a good idea. Are you really
> using all or most of the values in this 1.5e9 range? The documentation
> suggests using categorical_column_with_hash_bucket if not.
